issue.title: Is it possible to run RetroArch for W98SE/W2K/WME in DOSBox-X?
issue.body:
### Question

https://www.retroarch.com/?page=platforms

Here is the link to where I downloaded the type of RetroArch, as mentioned in the title, which again has a link to a YouTube video showing how to install and run it in Windows 2000, and it looks simple and straightforward. I'm running Windows ME in DOSBox-X (haven't been able to install any Windows NT so far), where I've installed this kind of RetroArch, but I can't get it to work. I don't know if it has something to do with the limitations of DOSBox-X, or if I'm missing some drivers or something. I have installed DirectX 9.0c from November 2008 and added DINPUT8.DLL to C:\Windows\System>, is there anything else I need to do?

### Have you checked that no similar question(s) exist?

- [X] I have searched and didn't find any similar question.

### Code of Conduct & Contributing Guidelines

- [X] I agree to follow the code of conduct and the contributing guidelines.

comment.body: You can't use dosbox or RetroArch they will crash use dosbox x

issue.title: Bug: DOS attempt to use DOS_GetMemory() while changing floppy
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

A fatal error occurs if you:

- boot MS-DOS 6.22 floppy no. 1
- exit setup
- use DOS menu to change floppy

at this point, it fires an `E_Exit: DOS:Attempt to use DOS_GetMemory() when private area was unmapped by BOOT` error.

### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

See above.

### Expected behavior

Floppies can get changed.

### What operating system(s) this bug have occurred on?

Windows 11 x64 22H2

### What version(s) of DOSBox-X have this bug?

2023.10.06

### Used configuration

_No response_

### Output log

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_

### Have you checked that no similar bug report(s) exist?

- [X] I have searched and didn't find any similar bug report.

### Code of Conduct & Contributing Guidelines

- [X] I agree to follow the code of conduct and the contributing guidelines.

comment.body:
Okay, so you can close this issue for the time being, and of course re-open it when you find out how to reproduce it.
There should be some additional conditions to reproduce your issue.

pull_request.title: [DRAFT] Cleaning up the README
pull_request.body:
The goal is to improve the readability of the README.

While it's extremely verbose, it isn't very comfortable to read and scattered at times.

One of the thing that should be addressed are the paragraphs, i.e. jumping lines will help a lot.

Etc, that will take some time so making this as a draft as I've only scratched the surface for now.

To compare the differences, the easiest is probably to look at them side to side:

https://github.com/joncampbell123/dosbox-x/blob/master/README.md

https://github.com/aybe/dosbox-x/blob/readme-cleanup/README.md

Feel free to comment, suggest and so on.

issue.title: DOSBox-X  black screen
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

When i try to run a "Super Boulder Dash" which is made for Tandy or PCJR macines and have better sound and graphic then on SVGA_S3, i have no graphic just a sound like it should. Appears black screen on DOSBox-X.

I try to drag-drop ".bat" file with running code, but nothing.
I also try to "mount" folder and run, but nothing again.

So, if i change:

machine=tandy or machine=pcjr, should work, but not.

It is same thing on DOSBox-X x86 or x64 (mingw, mingw-sdl2).

I will attach a problem screenshot, and the Game.zip with dosbox-x.conf.
In dosbox-x.conf, "machine" is changed to "tandy".

Link to the game: [](https://www.xtcabandonware.com/game/2071/super-boulder-dash)
![Problem](https://github.com/joncampbell123/dosbox-x/assets/68502401/aafc4327-c0e8-4c92-a3b1-470100cd9a1e)
[Game.zip](https://github.com/joncampbell123/dosbox-x/files/13176681/Game.zip)


### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

1. In DosBox-X folder, in file "dosbox-x.conf", section "[dosbox]" change option "machine" to "tandy or pcjr"
2. Create ".BAT" file in game folder with code "boot boulder.img"
3. Drag-drop ".BAT" file to "dosbox-x.exe" to run the game
4. When you want to start the game press "1" or "2" (this must be shown on the screen)
5. You will hear correct sound
6. Problem: Black Screen.

### Expected behavior

I expected to work like on DosBox...
I will attach the pictures for better explaining. This screenshots are from DosBox.

![1](https://github.com/joncampbell123/dosbox-x/assets/68502401/27f51ef5-2e65-463c-94eb-49863d716356)
![2](https://github.com/joncampbell123/dosbox-x/assets/68502401/f61f00f9-8a27-4748-8f9a-6d316c928d00)


### What operating system(s) this bug have occurred on?

Windows 7 Ultimate SP1

### What version(s) of DOSBox-X have this bug?

2023.10.06

### Used configuration

```ini
This configuration is from "dosbox-x.conf", and changed just a single line, "machine" to "tandy".

[dosbox]

machine = tandy
```


### Output log

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_

### Have you checked that no similar bug report(s) exist?

- [X] I have searched and didn't find any similar bug report.

### Code of Conduct & Contributing Guidelines

- [X] I agree to follow the code of conduct and the contributing guidelines.

comment.body:
I don't see any blackscreen, however I see some wheeling glitches.
Tested on 2023.10.06release and latest nightly (VS and MinGW builds) by following command.
```
dosbox-x -defaultconf -set machine=tandy
```
and `boot boulder.img`

![boulder](https://github.com/joncampbell123/dosbox-x/assets/68574602/16e45698-1350-440f-9da9-ca49b137acfc)

issue.title: [Feature Request] Emulate other 3D accelerators like the Savage series, Riva series, Voodoo 3, and (if possible) Diamond Edge
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Kind of. Voodoo 1 being the only accelerator that can be emulated in DosBox-x sorta disappoints me, and I would like to see other 3D accelerators of the 90s be emulated.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
If possible, please implement emulation for the early cards in the S3 Savage series and NVidia Riva series. And possibly Diamond Edge, although this might be me losing my mind.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
The only alternative is to emulate Voodoo1, which isn't that advanced.

**Additional context**
On the other hand, emulation of these other accelerators might be tricky, as currently 3D emulation in Windows 9x in DosBox-x is weird; polygons may stretch in games like The Sims 1 and Tomb Raider 2. 3D emulation in MS-DOS doesn't have this problem.
![dosbox-x_2020-07-31_09-10-40](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50080567/89091439-00fe9d00-d367-11ea-966d-63ded2beca54.png)
Also, emulation of the Savage, the Riva, and definitely the Diamond Edge might be too out of scope for DosBox-x. Either way, it would be nice to see emulation of these MS-DOS/Windows 95-era 3D graphics cards.

comment.body: None or suitable right now for actual use.

issue.title: Windows NT, 2000, XP - how to install them as guest?
issue.body:
### Question

Version 0.84.0 among other things "fixes problems with the IDE driver in Windows NT 4.0, Windows 2000, and Windows XP and allows them to boot properly"

At [NOTES](https://github.com/joncampbell123/dosbox-x/tree/master/NOTES) there are mentioned:
- WinNT 3.1 - workaround making it possible to boot since long time ago
- WinNT 3.51, NT4, 2000 - couldn't boot in the past
- WinXP - copies a few files and gives an error

My attempts with 0.84.0 are unsuccessful so far. Following the NOTES files, after first installing MS-DOS 6.22 I ran "WINNT.EXE /b" from an NT4 ISO and setup finished properly - but on first boot I got a crash: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97228894/171592728-ece9ffa4-38b3-444d-ba36-28d4c738620c.png)

From what I see floppy emulation is still missing (#3436), correct? So, it's either via MSDOS and WINNT.EXE /b - or via CD.ISO boot, correct?

I get "El Torito bootable floppy not found" when trying "imgmount a -bootcd d" - for ISOs of NT4, 2000, ReactOS, Vista. Strangely OS/2 4.52 ISO was accepted as bootable, but crashes:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97228894/171592318-8ac99558-cece-4f28-a853-1bad4964e5df.png)

Haven't tried NT3.1, NT3.5 and XP yet.

After mounting some of the CDs and looking inside DOSbox finds only a README.TXT file stating 'your OS needs to support UDF', 'your OS needs to support Joliet' - not sure if I do something wrong? would be nice if DOSbox-X can read those directly.

Will there be guide(s) added to the [wiki](https://dosbox-x.com/wiki/Guide:Microsoft-Windows-in-DOSBox‐X#_guides_to_installing_windows) about those? @rderooy 

### Have you checked that no similar question(s) exist?

- [X] I have searched and didn't find any similar question.

### Code of Conduct & Contributing Guidelines

- [X] I agree to follow the code of conduct and the contributing guidelines.

comment.body:
> @Pierrestro what is the required `dosbox.conf` for booting that image?

256mb of ram and pentium II not III

I haven't had time to do a full survey, but do you know which of the values ​​are the closest to complete?

issue.title: Floppy "mount twice" bug
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

If you boot a real DOS and mount a floppy image (via DOS menu, instead of the grayed "Unit" menu: and with confirmation prompt... quite awkward! but this is another bug/lack!), and then mount another floppy, the first floppy can't be get mounted again (i.e., during DOS/Windows setup) nor swapped any way.

I've noticed with procexp64, also, that resetting the DOSBox-X (F11+R) does not close the handles of the previously mounted floppy images - that's probably the reason why they can't get mounted again: some fclose missing.

It could be linked with the problem #4550.

### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

See above.

### Expected behavior

A floppy (or other disk) image can be (re)mounted infinite times.

### What operating system(s) this bug have occurred on?

Windows 11 x64 22H2

### What version(s) of DOSBox-X have this bug?

2023.10.06

### Used configuration

_No response_

### Output log

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_

### Have you checked that no similar bug report(s) exist?

- [X] I have searched and didn't find any similar bug report.

### Code of Conduct & Contributing Guidelines

- [X] I agree to follow the code of conduct and the contributing guidelines.

comment.body: Also, after MS-DOS 6.22 setup and first reboot, floppy images 2 & 3 are still locked by DOSBox-X.

From what I see floppy emulation is still missing (#3436), correct? So, it's either via MSDOS and WINNT.EXE /b - or via CD.ISO boot, correct?

I get "El Torito bootable floppy not found" when trying "imgmount a -bootcd d" - for ISOs of NT4, 2000, ReactOS, Vista. Strangely OS/2 4.52 ISO was accepted as bootable, but crashes:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97228894/171592318-8ac99558-cece-4f28-a853-1bad4964e5df.png)

Haven't tried NT3.1, NT3.5 and XP yet.

After mounting some of the CDs and looking inside DOSbox finds only a README.TXT file stating 'your OS needs to support UDF', 'your OS needs to support Joliet' - not sure if I do something wrong? would be nice if DOSbox-X can read those directly.

Will there be guide(s) added to the [wiki](https://dosbox-x.com/wiki/Guide:Microsoft-Windows-in-DOSBox‐X#_guides_to_installing_windows) about those? @rderooy 

### Have you checked that no similar question(s) exist?

- [X] I have searched and didn't find any similar question.

### Code of Conduct & Contributing Guidelines

- [X] I agree to follow the code of conduct and the contributing guidelines.

comment.body: @Pierrestro what is the required  `dosbox.conf` for booting that image?

issue.title: DOSBox-X  black screen
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

When i try to run a "Super Boulder Dash" which is made for Tandy or PCJR macines and have better sound and graphic then on SVGA_S3, i have no graphic just a sound like it should. Appears black screen on DOSBox-X.

I try to drag-drop ".bat" file with running code, but nothing.
I also try to "mount" folder and run, but nothing again.

So, if i change:

machine=tandy or machine=pcjr, should work, but not.

It is same thing on DOSBox-X x86 or x64 (mingw, mingw-sdl2).

I will attach a problem screenshot, and the Game.zip with dosbox-x.conf.
In dosbox-x.conf, "machine" is changed to "tandy".

Link to the game: [](https://www.xtcabandonware.com/game/2071/super-boulder-dash)
![Problem](https://github.com/joncampbell123/dosbox-x/assets/68502401/aafc4327-c0e8-4c92-a3b1-470100cd9a1e)
[Game.zip](https://github.com/joncampbell123/dosbox-x/files/13176681/Game.zip)


### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

1. In DosBox-X folder, in file "dosbox-x.conf", section "[dosbox]" change option "machine" to "tandy or pcjr"
2. Create ".BAT" file in game folder with code "boot boulder.img"
3. Drag-drop ".BAT" file to "dosbox-x.exe" to run the game
4. When you want to start the game press "1" or "2" (this must be shown on the screen)
5. You will hear correct sound
6. Problem: Black Screen.

### Expected behavior

I expected to work like on DosBox...
I will attach the pictures for better explaining. This screenshots are from DosBox.

![1](https://github.com/joncampbell123/dosbox-x/assets/68502401/27f51ef5-2e65-463c-94eb-49863d716356)
![2](https://github.com/joncampbell123/dosbox-x/assets/68502401/f61f00f9-8a27-4748-8f9a-6d316c928d00)


### What operating system(s) this bug have occurred on?

Windows 7 Ultimate SP1

### What version(s) of DOSBox-X have this bug?

2023.10.06

### Used configuration

```ini
This configuration is from "dosbox-x.conf", and changed just a single line, "machine" to "tandy".

[dosbox]

machine = tandy
```


### Output log

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_

### Have you checked that no similar bug report(s) exist?

- [X] I have searched and didn't find any similar bug report.

issue.title: Bug: DOS attempt to use DOS_GetMemory() while changing floppy
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

A fatal error occurs if you:

- boot MS-DOS 6.22 floppy no. 1
- exit setup
- use DOS menu to change floppy

at this point, it fires an `E_Exit: DOS:Attempt to use DOS_GetMemory() when private area was unmapped by BOOT` error.

### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

See above.

### Expected behavior

Floppies can get changed.

### What operating system(s) this bug have occurred on?

Windows 11 x64 22H2

### What version(s) of DOSBox-X have this bug?

2023.10.06

### Used configuration

_No response_

_No response_

issue.title: Floppy "mount twice" bug
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

If you boot a real DOS and mount a floppy image (via DOS menu, instead of the grayed "Unit" menu: and with confirmation prompt... quite awkward! but this is another bug/lack!), and then mount another floppy, the first floppy can't be get mounted again (i.e., during DOS/Windows setup) nor swapped any way.

I've noticed with procexp64, also, that resetting the DOSBox-X (F11+R) does not close the handles of the previously mounted floppy images - that's probably the reason why they can't get mounted again: some fclose missing.

It could be linked with the problem #4550.

### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

See above.

### Expected behavior

A floppy (or other disk) image can be (re)mounted infinite times.

### What operating system(s) this bug have occurred on?

Windows 11 x64 22H2

### What version(s) of DOSBox-X have this bug?

2023.10.06

### Used configuration

_No response_

### Output log

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_

issue.title: [Feature Request] Emulate other 3D accelerators like the Savage series, Riva series, Voodoo 3, and (if possible) Diamond Edge
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Kind of. Voodoo 1 being the only accelerator that can be emulated in DosBox-x sorta disappoints me, and I would like to see other 3D accelerators of the 90s be emulated.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
If possible, please implement emulation for the early cards in the S3 Savage series and NVidia Riva series. And possibly Diamond Edge, although this might be me losing my mind.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
The only alternative is to emulate Voodoo1, which isn't that advanced.

**Additional context**
On the other hand, emulation of these other accelerators might be tricky, as currently 3D emulation in Windows 9x in DosBox-x is weird; polygons may stretch in games like The Sims 1 and Tomb Raider 2. 3D emulation in MS-DOS doesn't have this problem.
![dosbox-x_2020-07-31_09-10-40](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50080567/89091439-00fe9d00-d367-11ea-966d-63ded2beca54.png)
Also, emulation of the Savage, the Riva, and definitely the Diamond Edge might be too out of scope for DosBox-x. Either way, it would be nice to see emulation of these MS-DOS/Windows 95-era 3D graphics cards.

comment.body:
Those ATI machine types are experimental, and incomplete, and not suited for actual use at this point. This is also mentioned on the wiki.
https://dosbox-x.com/wiki/Guide%3AVideo-card-support-in-DOSBox%E2%80%90X#_ati_technologies

comment.body: @rderooy I understand. By the way, today I found out that (the) current version(s) of DOSBox-X already emulate SVGA ATI as multiple machine values.

issue.title: Can't transfer colon from AppleScript
issue.body:
### Question

Hi there,

With my previous iMac I used to run an AppleScript to launch and manage Dosbox.
Since I made the transition to MacBook Air (2023) with Apple Silicon, that doesn't run anymore... of course.
So I downloaded Dosbox-X. Thanks for that! And adjusted the script a little.

But I can't transmit a simple colon (:), which is absolutely necessary to change diectory.
It appears as a semicolon (;).
I've tried a lot of different key-combinations... but still no success.
Can you help me, please?

Cheers!

comment.body: It makes no sense to add "svga" as a machine option as there is no single svga standard. Every vendor had its own implementation, and often vendors even had multiple incompatible or partly compatible implementations.
